TIM BALE, PROFESSOR OF POLITICS, UNIVERSITY OF SUSSEX It's obviously damaging because Andy Coulson was a very effective media operator so he is losing someone who was incredibly useful to the David Cameron operation. It is also incredibly damaging because it questions Mr David Cameron 's judgment and that for a politician is one of the worst things you can possibly do. Being a politician is all about... picking the right people to do the right job and the decision to appoint Andy Coulson was controversial in the first place and it's clearly a big, big judgment call that David Cameron has got wrong. Q: What has stopped you from making really bold bets on technology? You've got more than$ 40 billion on the balance sheet. If you want to have substantial market share in smartphones, why not just acquire Research In Motion, maker of the BlackBerry? A: We've made bold technology bets.
